text: Eudonia triclera is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Edward Meyrick in 1905. It is endemic to New Zealand. The wingspan is about . The forewings are blackish-fuscous mixed with whitish. There is a small pale ochreous elongated subbasal spot in the middle and a broad ochreous-white postmedian band parallel to the termen. The subterminal line is whitish. The hindwings are dark fuscous. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1905 Category:Scopariinae Category:Moths of New Zealand Category:Endemic fauna of New Zealand Category:Taxa named by Edward Meyrick
title: Eudonia triclera
